alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 28 at 2:19AM MDT until March 28 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY BETWEEN 1 PM AND 7 PM FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT THURSDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK AND ALL OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Southwest winds will return and quickly strengthen this afternoon across northeast New Mexico. With humidity values dipping below 15 percent for a few hours, critical fire weather conditions are expected to the Northeast Plains and Highlands. More widespread critical fire weather conditions will return on Thursday. Very strong southwest winds, low humidity values, and high Haines values are expected. Humidity values may drop into the single digits for a few hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM MDT this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) this afternoon through early evening and again late Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph today. Southwest 30 to 40 with gusts near 60 mph on Thursday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values ranging from about 10 to 15 percent today and 8 to 13 percent on Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
